alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 3:30PM CDT until May 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. .Ongoing river rises are expected to continue on the Buffalo River, allowing it to cross into flood stage near Hawley. Additional rainfall is expected over the next 48 hours and may contribute to further rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...From late tonight to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Parts of Hawley City Park begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 8.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
